snippet: A loss of roughly $1 billion in income from discontinued operations in the year-earlier period accounted for much of the decline.
abstract: Twenty-first Century Fox reports quarterly net income of $1.21 billion, down 49 percent from $2.38 billion one year earlier; cites lost income from discontinued operations, falling ad revenue, lackluster movie releases and higher costs for sports television; shares rise slightly as Wall Street shrugs off decline.
lead_paragraph: A loss of roughly $1 billion in income from discontinued operations in the year-earlier period accounted for much of the decline.

headline.main: Profit Tumbles at Fox, but Cable Makes Gains
headline.print_headline: Profit Tumbles at Fox, but Cable Makes Gains
